Class ChatReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ChatReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ChatReceiver
extends java.lang.Thread
    Thread class that deals with receiving data from a remote host and relaying it back to the main chat program. You may assume that the socket is already connected in the constructor of this class. From there, your thread should wait for input to come in over the socket, read that data, and send it back to the display. If the socket is closed, the thread should terminate. The thread should also have a method that causes it to terminate, so the main program can kill the thread at any time. It should attempt to close the socket before exiting. $Id: ChatReceiver.java

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatReceiver

        public ChatReceiver(ChatDisplay cd,
                    SocketName n,
                    java.net.Socket sock)
        Constructor. The given Socket is already connected and ready for use.
        Parameters:
        cd - The ChatDisplay object that displays any error messages
        n - The name of the socket this thread goes with
        sock - The socket to receive data from

    • Method Detail

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Stop waiting for input and terminate this thread. You should also attempt to close the socket before exiting.

      • run

        public void run()
        Main thread execution loop. This method should contain a tight loop that attempts to read data from the socket, and relays it to to main display class. When an exception occurs, the thread should close the socket, clean up, and exit its loop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
